definition: to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
words/speech/to say/to talk
another name for 古今小說|古今小说[Gu3 jin1 Xiao3 shuo1], Stories Old and New by Feng Menglong 馮夢龍|冯梦龙[Feng2 Meng4 long2]

sentences.english: You can know this simple truth without speaking frankly.
sentences.chinese: 道理，不用明言你也應該知道的。

sentences.english: I believe everyone will understand why it is ashamed obviously.
sentences.chinese: 羞愧的原因相信不用我明言，大家也能理解。

sentences.english: And this is how we believe the currency and trade issues should be addressed.
sentences.chinese: 這對我們今天處理貨幣和貿易問題，實在是至理明言。

sentences.english: This word became Napoleon loved scholars a witticism.
sentences.chinese: 這句話就成了拿破崙愛護學者的一句明言。

to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to make sth difficult/to create obstacles
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
to give one's assent/to consent
to repel/to decline
to point out
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
be that as it may
to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
a secret/sth best not told to anyone/confidential information
